page.title: 18RECREATION
page.content: Children's Games Part Two: BULLDOG Bulldog is a game played by any number over three. One child is selected to be "it". The "it" calls all the children to run across the playground from one end to the other. If the "it" can catch a person before he can reach the other side of the playground then he joins the "it" and becomes a second "it" and together they call the children across and try to catch them. The game ends when all the children have been caught. A rougher version of Bulldog is often played where the "it" or "its" have to lift a child completely off their feet before they are caught(or pin them to the ground). These versions are often banned in schools because of the danger of accidents.
